author: The Linux Foundation
description:
Don't miss out! Join us at the next Open Source Summit in Seoul, South Korea (November 4-5). Join us at the premier vendor-neutral open source conference, where developers and technologists come together to collaborate, share knowledge, and explore the latest innovations and advancements in open source technology. Learn more at https://events.linuxfoundation.org/

Keynote: 3 Pillars of Open Source AI: Training, Inference, Agents - Mark Collier, General Manager, AI & Infrastructure, The Linux Foundation with Special Guests
title: Keynote: 3 Pillars of Open Source AI: Training, Inference, Agents - Mark Collier with Special Guests

author: The Linux Foundation
description:

Keynote: The AI Cocktail - Malte Pietsch, CTO & Co-founder, deepset

While many people have AI applications in production, yet many struggle to derive real value from them.
In this talk, we will look into two mixtures that teams should really pay attention to:
Mixing AI and Humans to ensure smooth efficient interaction loops
Mixing the right context for your agent (aka Context Engineering)
We will look at some best practices and discuss how to derive value from agents even though full autonomy might be years away for many applications...
title: Keynote: The AI Cocktail - Malte Pietsch, CTO & Co-founder, deepset

Keynote: Zero to 50 ExaFLOPS in Under a Year: Lessons from the Trenches - Hagay Lupesko, SVP, AI Inference, Cerebras Systems

The Cerebras Wafer Scale Engine is the world’s largest chip—50× bigger than a GPU and capable of over 100 petaFLOPS of AI compute. In less than a year, we scaled Cerebras Inference, powered by clusters of the Wafer Scale Engine, to more than 50 exaFLOPS—delivering the world’s fastest AI inference service for leaders like Meta, Mistral, and IBM. But the real story isn’t just speed—it’s scaling fast, and to a massive scale.

In this keynote, we’ll share lessons from that journey: what breaks (and when),
title: Keynote: Zero to 50 ExaFLOPS in Under a Year: Lessons from the Trenches - Hagay Lupesko

Sponsored Session: OpenSearch and the Path to a Trillion-scale Vector Database - Vamshi Vijay Nakkirtha & Navneet Verma, OpenSearch Project

This presentation explores the evolution of OpenSearch to enable trillion-scale vector workloads. As organizations increasingly rely on vector search to deliver more powerful AI and machine learning applications, OpenSearch has achieved technological leaps to support these rapidly accelerating requirements. The talk will reveal the advancements that unlocked massive performance breakthroughs—including 3x increases in search throughput, 3x better disk storage utilization, and 10x faster
title: Sponsored Session: OpenSearch and the Path to a Trillion-s... Vamshi Vijay Nakkirtha & Navneet Verma

author: The Linux Foundation

Learn more at https://events.linuxfoundation.org/

Sponsored Session: Vibing with Data -- Multi-Agent Data Modeling and Construction - Andreas Kollegger, Neo4j

Vibe coding is an amazing force multiplier. What about code's sidekick, data? Working with data could be like that too! We'll walk through a multi-agent system for data analysis, schema creation and knowledge graph construction. 

We'll see how to:
- generate a schema from a pile of files, then import them
- generate a schema for a domain, then synthesize the data
- attach hints for later retrieval
title: Sponsored Session: Vibing with Data -- Multi-Agent Data Modeling and Constructi... Andreas Kollegger

author: The Linux Foundation
description:
Don't miss out! Join us at the next Open Source Summit in Seoul, South Korea (November 4-5). Learn more at https://events.linuxfoundation.org/

Keynote: Build for Speed: Lessons from Empowering GenAI Research at Canva - Verena Dittmer, ML Engineering Manager, Canva

Building successful GenAI products doesn’t start with scale — it starts with speed: the ability to iterate quickly, validate ideas early, and reduce friction between research and production. At Canva, we’ve found that empowering ML researchers means designing platforms around their workflows — not forcing them to conform to rigid infrastructure.

In this keynote, I’ll share key lessons from building Canva’s GenAI research platform, now used by over 100 engineers. We’ll explore how we made “Demo in a Day”
title: Keynote: Build for Speed: Lessons from Empowering GenAI Research at Canva - Verena Dittmer

author: The Linux Foundation
description:

Securing AI Pipelines: Real-World Attacks on Kubernetes-Based AI Infrastructure - Abhinav Sharma, KodeKloud

When an ML engineer deploys a Stable Diffusion model to Kubernetes, they unwittingly create an attack surface unlike anything traditional security teams have encountered. I discovered this firsthand after our "perfectly secured" AI cluster was compromised.
In this no-holds-barred session, I'll demonstrate live exploits against common AI deployment patterns, showing how attackers pivot from an innocent model serving endpoint to exfiltrating proprietary models worth millions and compromising underlying infrastructure. F
title: Securing AI Pipelines: Real-World Attacks on Kubernetes-Based AI Infrastructure - Abhinav Sharma

author: The Linux Foundation
description:
Don't miss out! Join us at the next Open Source Summit in Seoul, South Korea (November 4-5). Join us at the premier vendor-neutral open source conference, where developers and technologists come together to collaborate, share knowledge, and explore the latest innovations and advancements in open source technology. Learn more at https://events.linuxfoundation.org/

The Art of Production Quality Retrieval - Chang She, LanceDB

Retrieval is a critical part of AI agents and applications. But making AI compelling and production quality requires more than just simple vector search.

In this talk, we will walk through the anatomy of a production retrieval system and discuss the following questions:
1. What are the common methods of retrieval and what are their strengths and weaknesses?
2. How to combine the results from multiple search methods?
3. How to generate features that yield better search results?
4. How to know you're improving things with each change?

From this talk you'll be able
title: The Art of Production Quality Retrieval - Chang She, LanceDB

Building a Conversational Knowledge Base - Kerim Satirli, Independent & Tu Nguyen, HashiCorp

As software engineers, we love to build good, maintainable code that works and doesn't panic. Or at least, that's what we aspire to. 

But when even the simplest projects depend on intimate knowledge of many protocols, and RFCs, on top of your project's domain-specific knowledge, mistakes happen.

In this session, Tu and I look at an assistant we built to help us deliver better code for embedded projects, we dive into how we optimized our model for our specific domain, share what we learned that works and what didn't.

Attendees can
title: Building a Conversational Knowledge Base - Kerim Satirli, Independent & Tu Nguyen, HashiCorp

Keynote: From POC to Profit: Deploying Customer-Facing AI Agents That Actually Work - Zhou Yu, Associate Professor, Computer Science Department, Columbia University

In today’s retail landscape, only the top 2% of customers receive white-glove, personalized, and proactive service—leaving the vast majority underserved and significant revenue untapped. But what if every customer could receive the equivalent of the Chase Private Client experience?
AI agents have the potential to transform this reality—unlocking better conversion rates, richer upsell opportunities, and stronger customer satisfaction. Yet most customer-facing age
title: Keynote: From POC to Profit: Deploying Customer-Facing AI Agents That Actually Work - Zhou Yu

Keynote: The Future for AI-First Enterprises is “Open” - How to Succeed and Not Get Left Behind - Manos Koukoumidis, CEO, Oumi

Enterprises that  continue to stay in the shallow waters of prompt design on top of closed models behind an API (OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, etc.) will be overspending (greater than 10x) and getting out-innovated by their competitors as the landscape has shifted. Open models have caught up with closed models giving a path to both large enterprises and even small startups to control their AI destiny, innovate freely and develop their differentiation. The key challenge for them though remains in toolin
title: Keynote: The Future for AI-First Enterprises is “Open” - How to Succeed and Not... Manos Koukoumidis

Panel Discussion: Sovereign AI: Building Bridges in a Fragmented Landscape - Anna Hermansen, Hilary Carter & Adrienn Lawson, The Linux Foundation; Anni Lai, Futurewei

The term “Sovereign AI" has sparked discussion around the future of AI and the role of open source in this trend. Cities, nation-states, and private and public organizations are interested in “sovereign" AI infrastructure as a way to build localized, relevant, and privacy-preserving solutions. LF Research, LF AI & Data, and Futurewei have partnered on a research study to explore this phenomenon, its motivations, challenges, and implications, and the role of op
title: Panel Discussion: Sovereign AI: Building... Anna Hermansen, Hilary Carter, Adrienn Lawson & Anni Lai

Technical Workshop: From Planning To Production-Ready RAG - Ezequiel Lanza, Intel & Andreas Kollegger, Neo4j, Inc

Enterprises struggle to integrate fragmented generative AI (GenAI) technologies. Due to its rapid evolution and diverse implementations, even top LLMs hallucinate when answering Kubernetes-related questions.
title: Technical Workshop: From Planning To Production-Ready RAG - Ezequiel Lanza & Andreas Kollegger

author: The Linux Foundation
description:
Sponsored by LF Education & FINOS

Whether you're a developer, DevOps engineer, or IT team leader, the way financial services builds and delivers technology is changing fast—and open source is at the center. From the FDC3 Standard driving firm-to-firm intercommunication, the Common Domain Model (CDM) providing a standardized domain model for the industry, open source is reshaping the fintech landscape.

This session introduces skills and certifications that can help you or your team stay ahead—whether you're advancing in your current role, leading others, or looking to break into the world of IT finance. You'll learn how open source is redefining innovation in financial services— and beyond.

In this webinar you'll:
- Understand how open source is accelerating innovation across financial services—and why it matters for your career or team strategy.
- Explore key open standards like FDC3 and the Common Domain Model (CDM) that are transforming interoperability and data consistency in fi
title: LF Live Webinar: Fork the Bank: How Open Source Is Rewriting the Rules of Finance
